column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////When it came to the steaks
column4: maybe just not living up to the hype.  The lady had a petite filet
column5: and although there's not a whole lot you can expect from a cut such as that (tenderness being the exception)
column6: it was disappointing that it actually dried out midway though the meal.  I had the much-lauded dry-aged bone-in ribeye
column7: which just didn't knock me over in any way.  Sure
column9: but didn't have that distinctive dry-aged flavor
column10: and also had a lot more fat than I would have liked
column11: even for a ribeye.  For a $60 steak
